brainly_data.question: Vince flew home from vacation with a heavy bag. With the first airline he flew, Vince had to pay $20 to check his bag, plus $5 for every kilogram that his bag was over the weight limit. The next flight was with another airline that had the same weight limit. Vince had to pay $4 per kilogram that his bag was over the weight limit, in addition to the checked bag fee of $25. By coincidence, the fees ended up being the same with both airlines. How far over the weight limit was the bag? Write a system of equations, graph them, and type the solution.
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.question: Vince flew home from vacation with a heavy bag. With the first airline he flew, Vince had to pay $20 to check his bag, plus $5 for every kilogram that his bag was over the weight limit. The next flight was with another airline that had the same weight limit. Vince had to pay $4 per kilogram that his bag was over the weight limit, in addition to the checked bag fee of $25. By coincidence, the fees ended up being the same with both airlines. How far over the weight limit was the bag? Write a system of equations, graph them, and type the solution.
all_answers.subject: Mathematics
all_answers.text: I got the equation of 20+5*x=25+x*4, x being the amount of kilograms over the weight limit. My answer was 5 kilograms over
